posts.name: Marcus Kauffman
posts.cooked:
At my last event we were having connection issues with our operator console laptop. An FTAA came over, plugged a USB drive into our laptop, and ran some sort of script.

I found the CSA usb tools (I think) - GitHub - JamieSinn/CSA-USB-Tool: Tool to download all files in a given FIRST season needed to support teams.

Just out of curiosity, what is on the FTAA usb drive?

link_counts.title: GitHub - JamieSinn/CSA-USB-Tool: Tool to download all files in a given FIRST season needed to support teams.

posts.name: Travis Weir
posts.cooked: Probably the CSA USB tools and also this: GitHub - FletcherS7/FRC-Driver-Station-Connectivity-Script: A script that performs the most common fixes for FRC Driver Station comm's issues

link_counts.title: GitHub - FletcherS7/FRC-Driver-Station-Connectivity-Script: A script that performs the most common fixes for FRC Driver Station comm's issues

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked: At Sacramento? Yeah that was probably me! https://driverstation.app is what I use, the readme explains everything that the script runs, also happy to answer any questions you have!

Maybe for worlds i will print out strip length cheat sheet.
